{{Use Australian English|date=October 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}} {{Infobox musical artist |name = A-Love |background = solo_singer |birth_name = Antonella Formosa |alias = A-Love |birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1983|3|21}} |birth_place = [[Rome, Italy]] |origin = [[Melbourne]], Australia |Instruments = Vocals |genre = Soul/[[Hip hop music|Hip hop]] |Occupation(s) = Singer-songwriter |years_active = |label = Duality Records
Crookneck Records |Related_acts = |website = }} '''''A-Love''''' is a female Australian-based MC from [[Melbourne, Victoria|Melbourne]]. Her debut album, ''Ace of Hearts'' was nominated 'Best Urban Release' in the [[ARIA Music Awards of 2008]].{{cite web|url=http://www.aria.com.au/documents/2008ARIAAwardFinalistsAnnounced.pdf|title=Emerging Artists dominate 2008 ARIA Award nominations|publisher=[[Australian Recording Industry Association|ARIA]]|accessdate=18 December 2008| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20081221024218/http://aria.com.au/documents/2008ARIAAwardFinalistsAnnounced.pdf| archivedate= 21 December 2008 | deadurl= no}} ==Biography== A-Love was born Antonella Formosa in Rome, Italy on 21 March 1983. Formosa's father, [[Ric Formosa]], a composer/arranger and an original member (lead guitarist) with the Australian band [[Little River Band]] and her mother, Vicki Formosa, was an [[Rhythm & Blues|R&B]] singer.{{quote|My earliest memories are of my Dad carting me around to different studios to these sessions, and playing on pool tables in old studios.|Antonella Formosa{{cite web|url=http://www.threedworld.com.au/music/features/2007/ALove--From-The-Heart/ |title=A-Love from the heart |publisher=3D World|date=3 December 2007|accessdate=18 December 2008}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}}} She attended [[Hawthorn, Victoria|Hawthorn]] Secondary College, graduating in 1999.{{cite web|url=http://namesdatabase.com/people/FORMOSA/ANTONELLA/63056 |title=Formosa, Antonella |publisher=Names Database |accessdate=18 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110714151843/http://namesdatabase.com/people/FORMOSA/ANTONELLA/63056 |archivedate=14 July 2011 |df=dmy }} Whilst her first experiences of playing music were with an all-girl band, which never made any public performances, she also discovered hip hop in high school and soon found herself waxing lyrical over beats.{{quote|Rest assured, if I was a better singer, I'd be a soul singer! [MCing] was just something that I fell in love with in my teens. I've always been heavily into lyricism, no matter what kind of musical style I've been interested in. The fact that hip hop let you just not mince words and be really direct and cram so much more content and originality into your lyrics than singing was the biggest thing for me.|Antonella Formosa}} In January 2000, Formosa met Draino from the [[Puah Hedz]]. He was keen to check out her writing and despite her reluctance, he made her feature on a track.{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/triplej/ozmusicmonth/s986700.htm |title=Next Crop Artists (2003) A-Love|publisher=[[Triple J]]|accessdate=18 December 2008}} The second track that she had ever recorded was with [[Muph & Plutonic|Muphin]], which later became "Some People" which featured on the album ''Despite the Odds''.{{cite web|url=http://www.heavyweighttv.com/artists.php?artist=A+-+Love |title=Artist Profile – A-Love |publisher=Heavyweight TV |accessdate=18 December 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080722013050/http://www.heavyweighttv.com/artists.php?artist=A+-+Love |archivedate=22 July 2008 |df=dmy }} She has since appeared numerous times on [[Triple J]]'s 'The Hip Hop Show', [[3PBS|PBS]]' 'The Formula' (now 'Hittin Switches') and 'Auscultation', [[3RRR|RRR]]'s 'Wordburner' and [[RMIT University]]'s [[Student Youth Network|SRA FM]]. She was progressing towards a Bachelor of Arts degree in [[Anthropology]] from [[La Trobe University]] and for two years she was the co-host of a hip hop radio show at La Trobe University. May 2002 marked A-Love's official solo introduction to the Australian hip hop and media circles, with her song "Petty" from the album, ''Culture of Kings Volume 2'' (the first ever Australian hip hop feature album on Triple J). "Petty" was put on medium rotation on [[Triple J]]. Formosa was a winner of the [[Nescafe Big Break]] competition in 2002, earning $20,000 with which to start up an independent record label and distribution company, Duality Records. As time progressed, she juggled the twin responsibilities of building a label and working on her own debut as an artist.{{cite web|url=http://cache.zoominfo.com/CachedPage/?archive_id=0&page_id=1664302048&page_url=%2f%2fnbb.tekgroup.com.au%2fwinners%2f2002%2fantonella_formosa.asp&page_last_updated=8%2f4%2f2006+5%3a12%3a10+AM&firstName=Antonella&lastName=Formosa|title=Hip Hop Artist's career gets a spin in the right direction|publisher=Zoom Info|date=1 January 2002|accessdate=18 December 2008}}{{Quote|I really concentrated on getting the admin and strategic side of the label going, but it just proved to be a bit too hard. I knew that it was either gonna be the music that went or the label – which is where we are now.|Antonella Formosa}} Formosa released her debut album, ''Ace of Hearts'' on 24 November 2007, on Crookneck Records. The album was produced by BVA (Mnemonic Ascent) with additional beats from [[Suffa]] ([[Hilltop Hoods]]) and Jase. Guests include [[Yungun]] (UK), Raph (Mnemonic Ascent), [[Spikey Tee]] (UK) and emerging indigenous MC Jim Blah. It was Triple J's 'Album of the Week' just three days after its release{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/triplej/review/album/s2099792.htm |title=A-Love : Ace of Hearts|publisher=Triple J|date=26 November 2007|accessdate=18 December 2008}} and was nominated for the 2008 [[ARIA Awards]] in the category of 'Best Urban Release'.{{quote|The minute that I stepped in the studio with BVA I knew the time was right to record this album. I felt hungry and inspired again, it all fell in place. The result is a bunch of songs with lasting sentiment; real stories about real life.|Antonella Formosa{{cite web|url=http://www.jplay.com.au/JSite/ViewArtist.aspx?ArtistID=3400&ShowFullBio=true|title=A-Love @J Play|publisher=J Play|accessdate=18 December 2008}}}} She was also nominated for two at the [[Jägermeister]] AIR (Australian Independent Record Labels Association) Awards in 2008, in the categories of 'Best New Independent Artist' and 'Best Independent Hip Hop Artist'.{{cite web |url=http://www.airawards.com.au/nominees/nominees-2008 |title=AIR Award Nominees 2008 |publisher=Australian Independent Record Labels Association |accessdate=18 December 2008 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160126082019/http://www.airawards.com.au/nominees/nominees-2008 |archive-date=26 January 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web|publisher=Billboard.biz|title=Yunupingu Wins AIR Awards Triple|url=http://www.billboard.biz/bbbiz/content_display/industry/e3iebd6a39896504e50fda355ba222fdf10|date=25 November 2008|accessdate=18 December 2008}} Formosa has performed with Mystik Journeymen (US), [[Anticon]], [[Hilltop Hoods]], [[Pegz]], [[MC Layla]], Kowhai, [[Bliss n Eso]], Scarz on 45, MC Que, [[TZU]], Bias B and DJ Brand {{Infobox saint | name = Abundius and Irenaeus | image = | imagesize = | alt = | caption = | titles = | birth_date = | birth_place = | death_date = 258 | death_place = Rome | venerated_in = | beatified_date = | beatified_place = | beatified_by = | canonized_date = | canonized_place = | canonized_by = | major_shrine = | feast_day = 26 August | attributes = | patronage = | issues = | suppressed_date = | suppressed_by = | quote = }}
'''Abundius and Irenaeus''' (died 258) were [[Ancient Rome|Roman]] [[martyr]]s during the reign of Roman Emperor Valerian (253-260).<ref>[https://www.catholic.org/saints/saint.php?saint_id=3862/ St. Irenaeus and Abundius] Retrieved on 22 Mar 2018</ref> Their feast in the Roman Martyrology is celebrated on August 26. Abundius also has separate commemorations in [[Augsburg]] and [[Orvieto]].
==Life== Abundius was a devout [[Christian]] of Rome, and Irenaeus was a sewer-keeper. Together, they buried the body of [[Saint Concordia]]. Saint Concordia was the nurse of [[Hippolytus of Rome|Hippolytus]]. On stating to Valerian the urban prefect that she was a Christian, she was beaten to death, and her body was thrown into the sewer. Irenaeus found the body of St.Concordia and with the help of his colleague Abundius, was able to retrieve it and deliver it to Justinus, who reverently buried her on 25 August in the cemetery of Hippolytus on the Ager Veranus. Her death, however, is commemorated on 22 February in the [[Martyrologium Hieronymianum]], with a clear indication that she was buried in the cemetery of St.Laurence on the [[Via Tiburtina]]. <ref name="Roman">{{cite book |last= Lapidge|first=Michael |date=2018 |title= The Roman Martyrs: Introduction, Translations, and Commentary|url=https://books.google.gr/books?id=1fU-DwAAQBAJ&lpg=PA324&ots=OUrdt-WWuD&dq=Abundius%20and%20Irenaeus&hl=ru&pg=PA324#v=onepage&q=Abundius%20and%20Irenaeus&f=false|page=324|publisher=Oxford University Press|location=United Kingdom}}</ref>
As a result of this activity, Irenaeus and Abundius after being reported to the prefect, were thrown into the sewer and suffocated by the orders of Valerian, on 26 August. Their bodies were recovered and buried by Justinus.<ref>[https://daily-prayers.org/saints-library/abundius-and-irenaeus-2/ Abundius and Irenaeus] Retrieved on 22 Mar 2018</ref>
Their story is a part of the cycle of stories of [[Hippolytus of Rome|Lawrence and Hippolytus]], and is generally considered untrustworthy.
==Veneration== A basilica was erected in their honor near [[San Lorenzo fuori le Mura]]. Their bodies are buried in the cemetery of [[Cyriaca|Saint Cyriaca]]. They are commemorated on 26 August in the [[Martyrologium Hieronymianum]].<ref name="Roman"/>
==References== {{Reflist}} *[[Frederick George Holweck|Holweck, F. G.]], ''A Biographical Dictionary of the Saints''. St. Louis, MO: B. Herder Book Co. 1924.
{{DEFAULTSORT:Abundius and Irenaeus}} [[Category:Groups of Christian martyrs of the Roman era]] [[Category:Year of birth missing]] [[Category:258 deaths]] [[Category:3rd-century Christian martyrs]] [[Category:Saints duos]]
{{saint-stub}}

revision.text: {{nihongo|'''Akiyoshi Umekawa'''|梅川 昭美|Umekawa Akiyoshi|March 1, 1948 – January 28, 1979}} was a Japanese [[mass murder]]er who killed a woman on December 16, 1963, and shot dead four people on January 26, 1979. Mass media also used a number of aliases, including '''Teruyoshi Umekawa''', '''Terumi Umekawa''', '''Akimi Umekawa''' and '''Akemi Umekawa'''. He was one of the rare criminals who was shot dead by Japanese police. ==Early life== Umekawa was born in [[Ōtake, Hiroshima|Otake]], [[Hiroshima Prefecture]]. He was a great reader and loved [[hardboiled]] fiction. On December 16, 1963, while he was 15 and still a [[minor (law)|minor]], he killed a woman. Although he was a murderer, he was still allowed to have guns because Japanese juvenile law protected his criminal history. He also saw the film ''[[Salò, or the 120 Days of Sodom]]''. He wanted to make a big incident 15 years after he committed the first murder. ==Mitsubishi Bank sporting gun kidnapping== Umekawa shot dead two employees and two policemen on January 26, 1979, in a [[Mitsubishi Bank]] in [[Sumiyoshi-ku, Osaka|Sumiyoshi-ku]], [[Osaka]]. He took 40 hostages at the bank. He asked them, "Do you know ''Sodom no Ichi'' (Japanese alternative title of ''Salò, or the 120 Days of Sodom'')?" He stripped women of their clothes. Rokuro Yoshida, who joined criminal investigations of [[Kiyoshi Ōkubo]] and [[United Red Army]], was appointed as the incident commander. "Zero" Company of the 2nd [[Riot Police Unit]] of the Osaka Prefectural Police Headquarters (one of the predecessors of the [[Special Assault Team]]s) were called, which was the first case in the history of Japanese Police Tactical Units. They fatally shot Umekawa on January 28, 1979. Yoshida stated there was no alternative to deadly force.{{cite web|url=http://homepage2.nifty.com/otani-office/flashup/n070522.html |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120709145742/http://homepage2.nifty.com/otani-office/flashup/n070522.html |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2012-07-09 |script-title=ja:口だけ出す人が何より困る |author=[[Akihiro Otani]] |language=Japanese |publisher=Otani Akihiro office |date=2007-05-22 |accessdate=2008-03-09 }} ==Media== His crime affected Japanese youths. Neko Oikawa said that he was the main reason why she did not have [[Left-wing politics|leftist views]].{{cite web|url=http://www.oikawaneko.com/diary/diary28.html |script-title=ja:私の体は脂肪でできてるの |language=Japanese |author=Neko Oikawa |publisher=OIKAWA NEKO OFFICE |date=2004-06-14 |accessdate=2008-03-10 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070518034053/http://www.oikawaneko.com/diary/diary28.html |archivedate=May 18, 2007 }} The story of the film ''[[Tattoo Ari]]'' was inspired by him, but an alternative name was used for him in the film.{{cite web|url=http://www.straydog.info/essay/200606_drama.html|script-title=ja:森岡流名前のつけ方|first=Toshiyuki|last=Morioka|language=Japanese|publisher=Straydog|accessdate=February 15, 2011}} ==See also== *[[Special Assault Team]] *''[[Salò, or the 120 Days of Sodom]]'' == References == == External links == *{{imdb title|id=0084772|title=Tattoo Ari}} *{{ja icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20071220022814/http://gonta13.at.infoseek.co.jp/newpage101.htm Mitsubishi Bank Incident] *{{ja icon}} [https://web.archive.org/web/20071215210304/http://www.alpha-net.ne.jp/users2/knight9/mitubisi.htm Mitsubishi Bank Murders] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Umekawa, Akiyoshi}} [[Category:1948 births]] [[Category:1979 deaths]] [[Category:Minors convicted of murder]] [[Category:Japanese mass murderers]] [[Category:Hostage taking in Japan]] [[Category:People shot dead by law enforcement officers]] [[Category:Deaths by firearm in Japan]] [[Category:People from Hiroshima Prefecture]] {{japan-bio-stub}} {{japan-crime-stub}}

{{orphan|date=April 2014}} '''Angelo Hays''' (born ca 1918) was a [[French people|French]] celebrity and inventor. He is best known for having survived a [[premature burial]] for two days.
==Accident and Burial== In 1937, Hays was involved in a [[motorcycle accident]] in which he was thrown from his vehicle headfirst into a brick wall. The doctors were unable to find a pulse and Hays was declared dead. His face had been so disfigured by the impact that his parents were not allowed to view his body. He was buried three days later in the village of [[Saint-Quentin-de-Chalais|St. Quentin de Chalais]].
Two days after the funeral, when Hays was exhumed for the purposes of an insurance investigation, forensic examiners were surprised to find that the body was still warm. They found that Hays had been in a coma resulting from his head injury; his body’s diminished need for oxygen had allowed him to survive for two days underground.<ref name=marshall>{{cite web|last=Marshall|first=Kelli|title=4 People Who Were Buried Alive (And How They Got Out)|url=http://mentalfloss.com/article/54818/4-people-who-were-buried-alive-and-how-they-got-out|work=mentalfloss|accessdate=18 February 2014|date=15 February 2014}}</ref>
==Aftermath== Following several surgeries and rehabilitation, Hays made a complete recovery and went on to become a minor French celebrity. People traveled from afar to speak with him, and in the 1970s he went on tour with a [[security coffin]] he invented, which featuring thick upholstery, a food locker, [[chemical toilet]], library, and radio transmitter.<ref name=marshall /><ref name=adams>{{cite news|last=Adams|first=Susan|title=A Fate Worse Than Death|url=https://www.forbes.com/forbes/2001/0305/193.html|accessdate=18 February 2014|newspaper=Forbes|date=5 March 2001}}</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}

{{Infobox civilian attack |title= Assassination of Taha Carım |image= |caption= |location=Vicinity of [[List of diplomatic missions of Turkey|Embassy of Republic of Turkey]], [[Vatican City]] |target=[[Taha Carım]] |date=9 June 1977 |time= |timezone= |type=[[Assassination#Modern methods|ambush]] |fatalities=1 killed |injuries= |perps=2 unidentified Armenian gunmen<ref name="terror1"> {{cite web |url=http://beta.atauni.edu.tr/ermenisorunu/diplomat/7tahacarim.html |title=İSMAİL EREZ (1919-1977) |accessdate=1 November 2010 }}</ref> }}
The '''assassination of Taha Carım''', [[Turkish people|Turkish]] diplomat and ambassador to [[Holy See]] took place on 9 June 1977 in [[Rome]], [[Italy]].
==Background== The fatal attack on Carım took place two years after the assassination of a Turkish ambassador to Austria, [[Daniş Tunalıgil]] and assassination of a Turkish ambassador to France, [[Ismail Erez]] by Armenian militant organization [[JCAG]].<ref name="terror1"/><ref> {{cite web |url=http://www.ermenisorunu.gen.tr/english/diplomats/index.html |title=TURKISH DIPLOMATS KILLED BY ARMENIAN TERRORISTS |accessdate=1 November 2010 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101002165018/http://www.ermenisorunu.gen.tr/english/diplomats/index.html| archivedate= 2 October 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> [[Taha Carım]] was serving as an Ambassador to Holy See since 2 November 1973. In March 1977, he was already threatened to be killed by Armenian militant groups. Due to earlier attacks on Turkish diplomats resulting in death, the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Turkey)|Turkish Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] decided to send security personnel to Turkish diplomatic missions abroad. Some time later, the Ambassador Carım requested the [[Italian police]] to lift the security service. Instead, he sufficed by obtaining a pistol to protect himself.<ref name="terror2">[https://books.google.com/books?id=gqUcV87-KvYC&pg=PA184&lpg=PA184&dq=Taha+Car%C4%B1m&source=bl&ots=LZvWT8Ekq9&sig=R9R9O2hROP6G38Ma-qGw9aJTdH8&hl=en&ei=zfGpTJm7PMGX4Aa7qJ3vDQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=5&ved=0CCUQ6AEwBDgU#v=onepage&q=Taha%20Car%C4%B1m&f=false Sedat Laçiner, ''"Ermeni sorunu, diaspora ve Türk dış politikası''], USAK, 2008, p. 184 {{ISBN|978-605-4030-07-1}}</ref>
==The attack== Carım was returning to his residence, and was shot by two unidentified gunmen from front and back having no chance of resistance.<ref name="terror2"/> The responsibility was claimed by JCAG.<ref>[http://www.ermenisorunu.gen.tr/turkce/diplomatlar/taha_carim.html TAHA CARIM 9 Haziran 1977]</ref>
==Legacy== In 2016, the papacy finally condemned of the 1977 assassination of Taha Carım in order to resolve a dispute with Turkey about the Armenian genocide. <ref>[http://www.dailysabah.com/diplomacy/2016/02/03/turkey-sends-back-recalled-vatican-ambassador Turkey sends back recalled Vatican ambassador]</ref>
==See also== *[[List of attacks by the Justice Commandos Against Armenian Genocide]] *[[List of Turkish diplomats assassinated by Armenian militant organisations]] *[[Assassination of Daniş Tunalıgil]] *[[Assassination of İsmail Erez]] *[[Assassination of Galip Balkar]] *[[Assassination of Erkut Akbay]] *[[Assassination of Orhan Gündüz]] *[[ASALA]]

{{Infobox military person |name=Bahman Jadhuyih |birth_date= |death_date=636 |birth_place= |death_place=[[Al-Qādisiyyah (historical city)|Al-Qadisiyyah]], [[Iraq]] |placeofburial= |image= |caption= |nickname= |allegiance=[[File:Derafsh Kaviani.png|20px]] [[Sasanian Empire]] |branch= [[Sasanian army]] |serviceyears= |rank= |commands = |unit= |battles= [[Muslim conquest of Persia]] |laterwork= }} '''Bahman Jādhūyah/Jādūyah''' (also '''Jādhōē/Jādōē'''; [[New Persian]]: {{lang|fa|بهمن جادویه}}), or '''Bahman Jādhawayh''' ({{lang-ar|بهمن جاذويه}}) (in [[Middle Persian]]: Vahūman Ĵādaggōw) was an Iranian general of the [[Sasanians]]. He had a reputation for being [[Anti-Arabism|anti-Arab]].<ref name="iranicaonline.org">[http://www.iranicaonline.org/articles/bahman-jaduya ''BAHMAN JĀDŪYA'', M. Morony, '''Encyclopaedia Iranica''']</ref> He is mostly known to have led the Sasanians to victory against the [[Arabs]] at the [[Battle of the Bridge]]. The Arab Muslims referred to Bahman as ''Dhul Hājib'',<ref>{{cite book|last=Ṭabarī|first=Yohanan Friedmann|title=The battle of al-Qādisiyyah and the conquest of Syria and Palestine|year=1992|publisher=SUNY Press|pages=56|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=lj9_SE3_DXkC&pg=PA56&dq=bahman#v=onepage&q=bahman&f=false|isbn=978-0-7914-0733-2}}</ref> ({{lang|ar|ذو الحاجب}}, "owner of bushy eyebrows").<ref name="iranicaonline.org"/> He is often confused with [[Mardanshah]],<ref name="iranicaonline.org"/> another Sasanian general.
== Biography == Nothing is known of his early life, but Bahman Jadhuyih is recorded as an old man by 634. Bahman may have been the son of the Sasanian commander [[Hormozd Jadhuyih]]. Bahman is first mentioned in 633, as one of the spokesmen for the Sasanians and a member of the Parsig faction led by [[Piruz Khosrow]].<ref name="Pourshariati 2008, p. 195">Pourshariati (2008), p. 195</ref> In 633, the Sasanian monarch ordered a [[Sasanian]] commander named [[Andarzaghar]] who was in charge of protecting the borders of [[Greater Khorasan|Khorasan]]<ref name="Pourshariati 2008, p. 195"/> to protect the western frontiers from the Arabs who were plundering Persia.
In 633, Andarzaghar, along with Bahman Jadhuyih, made a counter-attack against the army of [[Khalid ibn al-Walid]] at [[Battle of Walaja|Walaja]], but were defeated. After the defeat, Bahman fled to [[Ctesiphon]], where he found Yazdegerd sick. However, Bahman was shortly ordered by the latter to make a counter-attack against the Arabs. Bahman, however, disobeyed the child king and sent Jaban to fight the Arabs instead. Jaban, who was sent alone on the western front to confront the Arabs, was defeated at the [[battle of Ullais]].<ref>Pourshariati (2008), p. 196</ref>
When the Arabs under [[Abu Ubayd al-Thaqafi|Abu Ubaid]] were making an expedition in the [[Sawad]] in 634, [[Rostam Farrokhzād]] sent Bahman Jadhuyih and [[Jalinus]] against him with a force from the powerful [[Wuzurgan]] class, who had units such as [[Persian war elephants|war elephants]] and the [[Zhayedan]]. Rostam is known to have told Bahman that: "if Jalinus returns to the like of his defeat, then cut off his head."<ref>Pourshariati (2008), p. 217</ref>
During the battle, known as the [[Battle of the Bridge]], the army of Bahman had an advantage: the elephants in his army frightened the Arabs' horses, and which later resulted in the death of Abu Ubaid. The bridge was then broken by an Arab, and around 4,000 Arabs died by drowning and many others were killed by the Bahman's forces. [[Al-Muthanna ibn Haritha|Al-Muthanna]] managed to flee from the bridge and rally 3,000 Arab survivors; however, some of them fled back to [[Medina]]. Bahman did not pursue the fleeing Arab army.<ref>Richard Nelson Frye, ''The Cambridge History of Iran: The period from the Arab invasion to the Saljuqs'', Cambridge University Press, 1975. (p. 9)</ref> In 636 during the [[Battle of al-Qadisiyyah]] Bahman was killed by [[Al-Qa'qa' ibn 'Amr al-Tamimi|Qa’qa ibn Amr]] in revenge for the death of Abu Ubaid and the others killed at the Battle of the Bridge.<ref name="iranicaonline.org"/>

J. Lane<ref name=IBT>{{cite web| last=Jones| first=Melanie|title=Is T.J. Lane the Chardon High School Shooter? Facebook Rant, Twitter Photos Leaked Online |url= http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/305463/20120227/tj-lane-chardon-high-school-suspect-facebook.htm| work=International Business Times|accessdate=February 27, 2012}}</ref><ref name=RDrissel>{{cite web|last=Drissell|first=Rachel|title=Accused Chardon High School shooter T.J. Lane's legal case is far from normal, experts say |url= http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/03/legal_case_of_accused_chardon.html|work=cleveland.com|publisher=Cleveland Live LLC|accessdate=March 4, 2012}}</ref> | weapons = [[Ruger MK III]] [[.22 Long Rifle|.22 caliber]] [[Semi-automatic pistol|semi-automatic]] [[handgun]]<ref name=Horton2>{{cite web|last=Horton|first=John|title=T.J. Lane, accused Chardon High School gunman, appears in Geauga County Juvenile Court|url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/03/tj_lane_enters_plea_in_chardon.html| work= [[The Plain Dealer]]|publisher=Cleveland Live|accessdate=March 7, 2012}}</ref><ref name=Caniglia>{{cite web|last=Caniglia|first=John|title=T.J. Lane, accused in Ohio school shooting, described as quiet, smart, no outcast|url=http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2012/03/lake_academy_students_recall_q.html|work=The Plain Dealer|publisher=Cleveland Live LLC|accessdate=March 6, 2012}}</ref> }}
On February 27, 2012, a shooting took place at [[Chardon High School]] in [[Chardon, Ohio]], in which three students died within two days of the incident. Two other students were hospitalized, one of whom sustained several serious injuries requiring extensive rehabilitation, and the other suffered a minor injury. The seriously injured victim has since been declared permanently paralyzed. A sixth student sustained a superficial wound.
While rumors of a warning of the event having been posted on the Internet circulated, student witnesses identified the shooter as Thomas "T. J." Lane III, a 17-year-old male.<ref name=IBT /> Although police were initially hesitant to publicly identify the juvenile after he was apprehended, by the evening of February 28, authorities confirmed that the suspect was Lane.
The weapon Lane used in the shooting was a .22 caliber handgun. At an initial court hearing, the prosecutor revealed that he admitted to shooting 10 rounds of ammunition from the gun during the shooting, which began in the school cafeteria at approximately 7:30 a.m., shortly after school started. Although Lane told police that he did not know the victims and that they were chosen randomly, witnesses stated that it appeared he targeted a specific student and the group he was sitting with in the cafeteria.
After the shooting occurred, Lane reportedly left the building. Witnesses stated he was chased from the building by a teacher, and was arrested a short time later outside the school. Lane was ultimately indicted on three counts of aggravated murder, two counts of aggravated attempted murder, and one count of felonious assault. He was initially detained as a juvenile pending further court action.
Reaction to the event prompted a statement from [[List of Governors of Ohio|Ohio Governor]], [[John Kasich]]. Several prayer vigils were held and a fund for the victims was established. Thousands of people attended one of the vigils, at which the Governor spoke, the night after the attack. [[President of the United States|President]] [[Barack Obama]] gave his condolences to the school principal in a telephone call following the incident. Analysis of the crime and comparisons to similar attacks began immediately following the shooting.
In May 2012, a judge determined that Lane was competent to stand trial.<ref name=Kaufman>{{cite news|last1=Kaufman|first1=Tina|title=Judge rules TJ Lane competent to stand trial in Chardon shooting|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/news/local-news/oh-geauga/judge-rules-tj-lane-competent-to-stand-trial-in-chardon-shooting|accessdate=October 5, 2014|publisher=Scripps TV Station Group|date=May 2, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140225215306/http://www.newsnet5.com/news/local-news/oh-geauga/judge-rules-tj-lane-competent-to-stand-trial-in-chardon-shooting#|archive-date=February 25, 2014|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Later that month the decision was made to charge Lane [[Trial as an adult|as an adult]].<ref name=CanigliaPD>{{cite news|last1=Caniglia|first1=John|title=T.J. Lane to be tried as adult in Chardon High School shootings|url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/05/judge_decides_tj_lane_should_b.html|accessdate=October 5, 2014|agency=The Plain Dealer|publisher=The Plain Dealer|date=May 24, 2012}}</ref> He pleaded guilty and received three [[life imprisonment|life sentences]] on March 19, 2013.
On September 11, 2014, Lane, along with two other inmates, escaped from [[Allen Correctional Institution]] in [[Lima, Ohio]]. He was recaptured the following day.
==Details== {| style="float:right; margin:0 0 0 1em; width:20em; border:1px solid #a0a0a0; padding:5px; background:#f5f5f5; text-align:left;" |- style="text-align:center; background:#ddd;" |'''Casualties''' |- style="text-align:left; font-size:x-small;" |1. '''Daniel Parmertor''', 16 (deceased)<ref name=WKYC /> |- style="text-align:left; font-size:x-small;" |2. '''Russell King, Jr.''', 17 (deceased)<ref name="2nd" /><ref name=Cleveland.com>{{cite web|title=Chardon shooting victim Russell King described as 'very social kid'| url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/02/chardon_shooting_victim_russel.html|publisher=Cleveland Live LLC|accessdate=February 28, 2012}}</ref> |- style="text-align:left; font-size:x-small;" |3. '''Demetrius Hewlin''', 16 (deceased)<ref name="3rd">{{cite web |url=http://fox8.com/2012/02/28/chardon-ohio-high-school-shootings |title=Chardon High School Shootings: 3rd Student is Dead |publisher=Fox8 Cleveland |date=February 28, 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Farkas|first=Karen|title=Demetrius Hewlin of Chardon dies after shooting at Ohio high school| url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/02/third_student_dies_after_shoot.html|newspaper=The Plain Dealer|date=February 28, 2012}}</ref><ref name=Donaldson>{{cite web| last= Donaldson| first= Stan|title=Chardon shooting victim Demetrius Hewlin liked to work out at the gym|url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/02/chardon_shooting_victim_demetr.html| publisher=Cleveland Live LLC|accessdate=February 28, 2012}}</ref> |- style="text-align:left; font-size:x-small;" |4. '''Nate Mueller''', 16 (minor injury to ear)<ref name=WKYC /><ref>{{cite news| title= Chardon High School student describes shooter's silent rampage| first= Patrick |last= O'Donnell| date= February 27, 2012 | website= Cleveland.com; The Plain Dealer| url= http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/02/chardon_high_school_student_de.html | access-date= August 15, 2016}}</ref> |- style="text-align:left; font-size:x-small;" |5. '''Nick Walczak''', 17 (shot multiple times in his neck, arm, and back; a bullet also lodged in his cheek; paralyzed)<ref name=WKYC /><ref>{{cite news| url= http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/03/nick_walczak_begins_rehab_at_m.html | title= Nick Walczak, survivor of Ohio school shooting, begins rehab at MetroHealth| first= Angela |last= Townsend| work= Cleveland.com The Plain Dealer |location= Cleveland| date= March 5, 2012| access-date= August 15, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| url= http://abcnews.go.com/US/ohio-school-shooting-hospitalized-victim-bullets-cheek-neck/story?id=15826214| title= Ohio School Shooting Survivor Has Bullets in Cheek and Neck| first= Christina | last= Ng| website= ABCNews.go.com| date= March 1, 2012| access-date= August 15, 2016}}</ref> |- style="text-align:left; font-size:x-small;" |6. '''Joy Rickers''', 18 (injured; released from hospital after approximately 24 hours)<ref name=WKYC /><ref>{{cite web| url= http://fox8.com/2012/02/28/shooting-survivor-released-from-hillcrest-hospital/| title= Shooting Survivor Released from Hillcrest Hospital | date= February 28, 2012| first= Jessica | last= Dabrowski| website= fox8.com | access-date= August 15, 2016}} </ref> |} The shooting began at approximately 7:30 a.m. (EST) in the Chardon High School cafeteria.<ref name=USNews>{{cite web|title=Official: 5 hurt, 3 Dead in Ohio high school shooting|url=http://usnews.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/02/27/10517706-official-5-hurt-in-ohio-high-school-shooting|publisher=MSNBC.com|accessdate=February 27, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120227171500/http://usnews.msnbc.msn.com/_news/2012/02/27/10517706-official-5-hurt-in-ohio-high-school-shooting|archive-date=February 27, 2012|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref> A student witness said that the shooting began in the cafeteria before first period while students were eating breakfast. According to reports, a boy stood up and began shooting, causing chaos.<ref name= "Horton 5 students">{{cite web|last=Horton|first=John|title=5 students hurt in shooting at Chardon High School; suspect in custody| url=http://blog.cleveland.com/metro/2012/02/at_least_4_students_hurt_in_sh.html|publisher=Cleveland Live LLC|accessdate=February 27, 2012}}</ref>
A surveillance video showed that Lane shot four male students in the cafeteria with a [[.22 LR|.22 caliber]] handgun. As he fled, Lane shot a female student,<ref name=Johnson>{{cite web|last=Johnston|first=Laura|title=Chardon High School emergency plan prepared community for shooting tragedy|url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/02/chardon_community_prepared_for.html|work=The Plain Dealer|accessdate=February 27, 2012}}</ref> and was then chased out of the school by a teacher, football coach Frank Hall.<ref name=Bell>{{cite news| last=Bell|first=Melissa|title=Chardon, Ohio students recount teachers’ bravery on Twitter |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/blogpost/post/chardon-ohio-students-recount-teachers-bravery-on-twitter/2012/02/27/gIQARYuBeR_blog.html|work=The Washington Post| accessdate=February 27, 2012|date=February 27, 2012}}</ref> Lane was arrested outside the school near his car on Woodin Road.<ref name="Horton 5 students" />
Initially, five students were hospitalized, three of whom later died.<ref name=Cleveland.com /><ref>{{cite web |title=Reported Shooting at Chardon High School |url=http://www.wytv.com/content/news/local/story/LIVE-STREAM-Reported-Shooting-At-Chardon-High/caBL7e2o8UOlWpfIwxEptg.cspx |publisher=New Vision Television |accessdate=February 27, 2012 }}{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> Two students, Joy Rickers and Nick Walczak, were taken to local [[Hillcrest Hospital]], while Daniel Parmertor, Russell King, and Demetrius Hewlin were flown by helicopter to [[MetroHealth|MetroHealth Medical Center]] in Cleveland.<ref name=USNews /> A sixth student, Nate Mueller, was superficially injured when a bullet grazed his right ear.<ref name=cbsnews.com />
===Fatalities=== At noon on February 27, 2012, Chardon Police Chief Tim McKenna announced in a news conference that one of the victims had died.<ref name=Fox1>{{cite web|last=Achladis|first=Ted|title=CHARDON HIGH SCHOOL SHOOTING: 1 Student Dead, 4 Others Injured|url=http://fox8.com/2012/02/27/chardon-high-school-on-lockdown/|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=February 27, 2012}}</ref> The first deceased student was identified as Daniel Parmertor, a 16-year-old<ref name=WKYC /> high school junior, by a spokeswoman for Cleveland's MetroHealth Medical Center. His family issued a statement requesting that their privacy be respected.<ref name=CBS1>{{cite news|title=1 dead in Ohio school shooting; Suspect detained| url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57385711/1-dead-in-ohio-school-shooting-suspect-detained/ |publisher=CBS News|accessdate=February 27, 2012}}</ref> When Lane opened fire, Parmertor was in the cafeteria waiting for a bus to the Auburn Career Center [[vocational school]] in nearby [[Concord Township, Lake County, Ohio|Concord Township]], where he studied computer science.<ref name=USNews />
At 12:42 a.m. the next day, a second student, Russell King, Jr., 17, was pronounced [[Brain death|brain dead]] at MetroHealth Medical Center.<ref name="2nd">{{cite news |url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2012/02/27/ohio-high-school-on-lockdown-after-reports-shooting |title=Second student dies in shooting rampage at Ohio high school, authorities say |publisher=FoxNews.com |date=February 28, 2012}}</ref><ref name=ABC>{{cite web|title=Chardon High School Shooting: Second Student Dies as Alleged Gunman Is Identified| url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/chardon-high-school-shooting-gunman-identified-tj-lane/story?id=15799815#.T0z9FXmy_cg|publisher=ABC News|accessdate=February 28, 2012}}</ref> King, a junior, studied [[Energy engineering|alternative energy technologies]]. He was enrolled at both Chardon High School and at the Auburn Career Center.<ref name="Cleveland.com"/> King's family released a statement thanking the public for support and offering sympathy to the families of the other victims. They also said that his organs would be donated as he had wished.<ref name=WKYC-TV>{{cite web|title=Chardon High School shootings: 3 dead, 1 released| url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/232900/45/Chardon-High-School--shootings-3-dead-1-released|date=February 28, 2012| publisher=[[WKYC-TV]]|accessdate=February 28, 2012}}</ref> A witness, Nate Mueller, said that King had recently started dating Lane's former girlfriend. Other student witnesses said that it appeared as if Lane was specifically aiming for King, indicating that he was the first to be shot. The students stated that King had previously threatened to beat Lane up. They told reporters that Lane had taken up weightlifting with the intention of fighting King.<ref name=Lieberman>{{cite web|last=Lieberman|first=Dan|title=Ohio School Shooter Allegedly Killed Ex-Girlfriend's New Boyfriend, Students Tell ABC News|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/ohio-school-shooting-victim-dating-tj-lanes-girlfriend/story?id=15834378#.T1fV8Hmy_cg|work=abcnews.com|publisher=ABC News Network|accessdate=March 7, 2012}}</ref>
On February 28, 2012, it was reported that Demetrius Hewlin, the third student who was transferred to MetroHealth, had died.<ref name=WKYC>{{cite web|title=Chardon High School shooting: Victims identified|url=http://www.wkyc.com/news/article/232773/45/Chardon-High-School-shooting-Victims-identified|publisher=WKYC.com|accessdate=February 28, 2012}}</ref> His family also expressed their sorrow for their loss in a statement to the press.<ref name="3rd"/> Friends of Hewlin said that he liked to work out and wanted to be on the football team.<ref name=Donaldson /> Hewlin's mother, Phyllis Ferguson, in an interview with [[ABC News]] said of her son, "He wasn't a morning person and he was late for school. But that one day he wasn't late. We were running a little late, but we weren't late enough. But it's okay. It's in God's hands. Let His will be done." When questioned about what she would say to the assailant, she said that she would forgive him, because most school shooters did not know what they were doing.<ref name=HuffPost2>{{cite news|title=T.J. Lane, Ohio School Shooting Suspect, Forgiven By Slain Child's Mother|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/29/ohio-school-shooting-suspect-tj-lane_n_1311956.html|work=HuffingtonPost.com|publisher=The Huffington Post|accessdate=March 1, 2012|first=David|last=Moye}}</ref> She explained that her son's organs would be donated and that one of the recipients was a child who was within days of death without a transplant.<ref name=Ng>{{cite web|last=Ng|first=Christine|title=Ohio School Shooting Survivor Has Bullets in Cheek and Neck|url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/ohio-school-shooting-hospitalized-victim-bullets-cheek-neck/story?id=15826214#.T1gLkXmy_ch|work=abcnews.com|publisher=ABC News Network|accessdate=March 7, 2012}}</ref>
===Other victims=== One of the two injured students who had been transferred to Hillcrest Hospital, 17-year-old Nick Walczak, was shot several times, and one bullet lodged in his cheek. He was also shot in the arm, neck and back. Joy Rickers, 18, was released from Hillcrest Hospital on February 28.<ref name=WKYC-TV /> Nate Mueller, who was not hospitalized, was nicked in his right ear by a bullet.<ref name=WKYC /> Mueller and Walczak, students of Auburn Career Center, were waiting with Parmertor and King for the bus that would transfer them to their school on the morning of the shooting.<ref name=Krouse>{{cite web|last=Krouse|first=Peter|title=Chardon student Danny Parmertor killed in shooting liked snowboarding and wanted to work with computers|url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/02/student_killed_in_shooting_lik.html|work=The Plain Dealer|publisher=Cleveland Live LLC|accessdate=March 1, 2012}}</ref>
===Teacher actions=== After the shooting, students referred to two teachers, Frank Hall and Joseph Ricci, as heroes. ''[[The Daily Beast]]'' reported that news of the men's "courageous actions" spread when students expressed thanks on [[Twitter]]; the reports indicated that Hall had charged at the shooter despite the shooter pointing his gun at Hall.<ref name=DailyBeast>{{cite web| last= DeLuca |first= Matthew|title=Chardon School Shooting’s Hero Teachers|url=http://www.thedailybeast.com/articles/2012/02/27/chardon-school-shooting-s-hero-teachers.html|work=The Daily Beast| publisher=The Newsweek/Daily Beast Company LLC |accessdate= February 28, 2012}}</ref> A student told reporters that Hall frequently spoke of how much he cared for the students, a feeling which was shown by his actions.<ref name=Jones>{{cite web|last=Jones|first=Melanie|title=Who is T.J. Lane? 5 Things to Know About Chardon High School Shooting Suspect|url=http://www.ibtimes.com/articles/306023/20120228/tj-lane-ohio-chardon-high-school-shooting.htm| work= International Business Times| publisher=The International Business Times Inc|accessdate=February 29, 2012}}</ref>
Meanwhile, Joe Ricci had just started his math class when he heard shots and ordered his students to "lockdown". According to a student witness, when Ricci heard moaning outside his classroom, he put on a bulletproof vest,<ref name=Severance>{{cite web|last=Severance|first=Cristin|title=Chardon student calls teacher a hero|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/chardon-student-calls-teacher-a-hero|publisher=Scripps TV Station Group|accessdate=February 28, 2012}}</ref><ref name=Katrandjian>{{cite web|last=Katrandjian|first=Olivia|title=Ohio’s Hero Football Coach Says ‘I Wish I Could’ve Done More’|url=http://abcnews.go.com/blogs/headlines/2012/02/ohios-hero-football-coach-says-i-wish-i-couldve-done-more/|publisher=ABC News|accessdate=February 29, 2012}}</ref><ref name=CNNstaff>{{cite news|title=Ohio coach who chased school shooter deflects 'hero' label|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/03/01/justice/ohio-shooting-teacher/index.html|work=CNN Justice|publisher=Cable News Network. Turner Broadcasting System, Inc.|accessdate=March 2, 2012|date=March 2, 2012}}</ref> opened the door, dragged a wounded student, Nick Walczak, into the classroom and administered first aid.<ref name=HuffPost>{{cite news|title=Ohio School Shooting: Russell King Jr., Student At Chardon High School, Declared Brain Dead|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/28/ohio-school-shooting-student-brain-dead_n_1306185.html#s736038&title=Demetrius_Hewlin_|work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=February 28, 2012|first=Buck|last=Wolf|date=February 28, 2012}}</ref> Walczak's family credits Ricci with saving his life.<ref name=Ng /> A student described the teachers as "two of the greatest leaders in our school."<ref name=Jones/>
==Shooter== '''Thomas Michael "T. J." Lane III''' (born September 19, 1994) was identified by authorities as the suspect late on February 27.<ref name=IBT /><ref name=cbsnews.com>{{cite news|author= Crimesider Staff| title=Report: Student confirms ID of Chardon HS shooter as T.J. Lane|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-504083_162-57386079-504083/report-student-confirms-id-of-chardon-hs-shooter-as-t.j-lane/ |publisher= CBS News|accessdate=February 27, 2012}}</ref><ref name=Jones /><ref name=Dissell /> The authorities were reluctant to release his name, since he was still a juvenile, but ''[[CBS News]]'' reported that by early afternoon law enforcement officials had surrounded a house belonging to Lane.<ref name=cbsnews.com /> According to the ''[[International Business Times]]'', reports on the possibility of Lane's involvement led to great press interest, which the police initially deflected.<ref name=IBT />
The authorities searched the home of the suspect's paternal grandparents in [[Chardon Township, Geauga County, Ohio|Chardon Township]]. Lane did not live there but would frequently visit on weekends.<ref name=Baker>{{cite news |first=Brandon C. |last=Baker |coauthors= |title=Neighbors, Friends Describe the T.J. Lane They Knew |url=http://news-herald.com/articles/2012/02/28/news/nh5156887.txt |work=[[The News-Herald (Ohio)|The News-Herald]] |publisher= |date=February 28, 2012 |accessdate=February 29, 2012 }}</ref><ref name=Fox8>{{cite news |first=Lorrie |last=Taylor |coauthors= |title=Chardon School Shooting: Investigators Look for 'Anything, Everything' |url=http://fox8.com/2012/02/27/chardon-school-shooting-investigators-look-for-anything-everything/ |work= |publisher=[[WJW (TV)|WJW-TV]] |date=February 27, 2012 |accessdate=February 29, 2012 }}</ref> The residence, along with other properties owned by the Lane family, were searched extensively on the day of the shooting. A nearby forest, which neighbors said the Lane children used for target practice, was also combed.<ref name=Fox8 />
At the time of the shooting, Lane was not taking classes at Chardon High School, but at [[Lake Academy]], an [[Alternative school#United States|alternative school]] in nearby [[Willoughby, Ohio|Willoughby]]. The school, which is also known as the Lake County Educational Service Center, served 55 students in February 2012. They were referred there from public schools in the region because of academic or behavioral needs.<ref name=Glasier>{{cite web|last=Glasier|first=David|title=Lake Academy staff speak about quality education and students, not about suspected Chardon High shooter|url=http://www.news-herald.com/articles/2012/02/29/news/nh5158009.txt|work=The News-Herald|accessdate=March 6, 2012}}</ref><ref name=FoxNewsCrime>{{cite news|title=One student killed, four injured in shooting at Ohio high school|url=http://www.foxnews.com/us/2012/02/27/ohio-high-school-on-lockdown-after-reports-shooting/?test=latestnews| work=FoxNews.com|accessdate=February 27, 2012|date=February 28, 2012}}</ref> Students who complete their educations at Lake Academy graduate with their classmates at the sending schools.<ref name=Caniglia />
Witnesses said Lane appeared to be targeting students who were sitting together at one table.<ref name=Sheehan>{{cite news|last=Sheehan|first=Thomas|title=Ohio School Shooting: 5 Students Shot, 1 Dies At Chardon High School, Suspect In Custody| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/02/27/ohio-school-shooting-2012-chardon-high_n_1303988.html| work=The Huffington Post|accessdate=February 27, 2012|date=February 27, 2012}}</ref> Four of the five victims who were sitting at that table were students at the Auburn Career Center. The bus that Lane took from Chardon to Lake Academy was the same one that the Auburn students took, but his stop was farther on the route.<ref name=Krouse /> Lane also knew some of the victims from [[middle school]].<ref name=Caniglia />
There were rumors that there had been a warning about the shooting posted on [[Twitter]].<ref name=IBT /> News agencies published excerpts from the [[Facebook]] profile of a boy named "T. J. Lane". The profile did not give a location but several of the user's friends were listed as being from Chardon.<ref name=IBT /> One entry in particular, dated December 30, 2011, caught attention, especially the last line, which read: "Die, all of you."<ref name=GlobalGrind>[http://globalgrind.com/news/tj-lane-alleged-gunmen-chardon-high-school-shooting-letter-die-all-you-details "'Die, All Of You' T.J. Lane, Alleged Gunmen In High School Shooting, Writes Chilling Letter (DETAILS)"], ''GlobalGrind''. Retrieved on February 27, 2012.</ref> According to a comment posted by Lane on January 20, 2012, he wrote the text in class.<ref name=IBT /><ref name=GlobalGrind/>
===Reactions of friends=== A friend of Lane described him as "just a very normal teenage boy".<ref name=Pearson>{{cite news| last=Pearson| first=Michael|title=One dead, four hurt in Ohio high school shooting| url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/02/27/justice/ohio-school-shooting/index.html|publisher=CNN|accessdate=February 27, 2012|date=February 28, 2012}}</ref> She also told [[CNN]] that she was in "complete shock" from the incident, and that Lane often had a sad look in his eyes, but came across as completely normal.<ref name=Pearson /> Another friend said that Lane was regularly teased at school, which made Lane "put a wall around himself" and refuse to divulge personal information.<ref name=Pearson /> A third student told reporters that Lane had come from "a really broken-down home", and was a quiet person who could be nice to others if he felt comfortable with them.<ref name=IBT />
Students at Lake Academy denied that he had been bullied. They described him as friendly and nice, but not very talkative.<ref name=Caniglia /><ref name=Glasier />
===Weapon===
[[Image:Ruger mkiii bull.jpg|thumb|left|[[Ruger MK III|Sturm Ruger MKIII]]]] After Lane's arrest, law enforcement determined that the gun used in the shooting was purchased legally. Authorities said Lane had stolen the .22-caliber handgun from his uncle.<ref name="CNN Wire Staff">{{cite news|author = CNN Wire Staff | title=Prosecutor: Suspect admitted to shootings at school|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/02/28/justice/ohio-school-shooting/index.html| work=CNN.com |accessdate=February 28, 2012|date=February 29, 2012}}</ref> The press reported that it was a [[Ruger MK III|Ruger MK III Target]] [[.22 Long Rifle|.22 caliber]] [[semi-automatic pistol|semi-automatic]] [[handgun]].<ref name=Horton2 /> However, a neighbor who was close to the family said that it was a target [[revolver]] that belonged to the boy's grandfather.<ref name=Nicas>{{cite news|last=Nicas|first=Jack|title=Third Teen Dead in School Attack| url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052970204653604577250930031134726 |work= The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=March 7, 2012|date=February 29, 2012}}</ref> When asked how it was possible to fire as many as ten or more rounds from a revolver in quick succession, the neighbor had no explanation and eventually admitted that the revolver hypothesis was probably not true after all. Reports were that the shooter dropped the gun as he fled from the scene. It was found inside the school and recovered by police. Lane also admitted to taking a knife into Chardon High School.<ref name="CNN Wire Staff"/><ref name=Nicas/>
===Suspect's prior offenses=== On February 29, 2012, Timothy J. Grendell, the juvenile court judge presiding over Lane's case, allowed the release of the suspect's juvenile records to the press. According to his records, Lane was arrested twice in December 2009. The first time, Lane restrained his uncle while his cousin hit him. The other case involved Lane hitting another boy in the face.<ref name=focus>{{cite web| last=Glasier|first=David|title=T.J. Lane's history in focus: Records indicate Chardon shooting suspect has troubled past|url=http://news-herald.com/articles/2012/03/11/news/nh5209273.txt | work= The News-Herald | publisher= Journal Register |accessdate=March 12, 2012}}</ref> To the second charge, Lane pleaded to a count of disorderly conduct.<ref name=records>{{cite web|title=Judge makes accused Chardon shooter T. J. Lane's delinquency records available to media| url=http://news-herald.com/articles/2012/02/29/news/doc4f4eaeefe11dd328667165.txt |work= The News-Herald |date= February 29, 2012| accessdate=March 12, 2012}}</ref>
==Trial== On February 28, 2012, at 3:50 p.m. (EST), a detention hearing was held for the suspect at [[Geauga County, Ohio|Geauga County]] [[Juvenile Court]] in Chardon. According to the ''LA Times'', in the United States teenage suspects are generally treated as juveniles until prosecutors decide to charge them as adults.<ref name=Stanburn>{{cite web| last=Stanburn |first=Samatha|title=Chardon school shootings: Third student dies| url=http://www.globalpost.com/dispatch/news/regions/americas/united-states/120228/chardon-school-shooting-tj-lane-court| work= Global Post|accessdate=February 28, 2012}}</ref> Judge [[Tim Grendell]] began the proceeding by asking the media not to take photographs of the defendant until it was determined whether or not he would be tried as an adult.<ref name=3rd /> He immediately ruled that the defendant would remain in custody. At the prosecutor's request, the judge directed that the attorneys involved in the case refrain from speaking to the media regarding the proceeding.<ref name=Begos>{{cite web |last=Begos |first=Kevin |title=Prosecutor: School shooter chose random victims |url=http://www.fox10tv.com/dpps/news/national/midwest/court-hearing-tuesday-for-suspect-in-ohio-shooting-nt12-jgr_4086902 |publisher=Fox News |accessdate=February 28, 2012 }}{{Dead link|date=November 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He then outlined conditions under which the media could participate, including not taking any facial photographs of the defendant or his family. After hearing the prosecutor's argument for continuing the detention and receiving no objection, the judge ruled that detention, at the Portage-Geauga Juvenile Detention Center in [[Ravenna, Ohio]], should continue for 15 days.<ref name=Farkas>{{cite web|last=Farkas|first=Karen|title=T.J. Lane, Ohio school shooting suspect, chose victims at random, prosecutor says| url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/02/tj_lane_suspect_in_shootings_a.html |work= The Plain Dealer |publisher=Cleveland Live LLC}}</ref> The issues of arraignment and possible transfer to adult court were put off to future dates. The judge stated that the prosecution had until March 1, 2012, to file charges.<ref name=Begos />
After the hearing, prosecutor [[David Joyce (politician)|Dave Joyce]] indicated that he would attempt to try Lane as an adult and file three counts of [[Murder#Aggravating circumstances|aggravated murder]], among other charges, for the incident.<ref name=Farkas /> It was revealed at the hearing that Lane admitted to shooting 10 rounds of ammunition during the incident. He also told the police that he did not know the victims and that they were selected randomly.<ref name=Begos /><ref name=Farkas /> However, a witness who said he knew the shooter indicated that Lane knew several of the victims.<ref name=Farkas />
Outside defense attorneys observing the hearing questioned whether Lane's attorney was protecting his client's rights.<ref name=RDrissel /> First, a concern was raised that Lane's attorney agreed with the judge that the gag order would not go into effect until after the press conference that prosecutor Joyce held following the hearing. One lawyer explained that this exception to the order gave the prosecution the opportunity to announce the defendant's confession publicly, thus influencing the jury pool.<ref name=RDrissel /> A second concern regarded Joyce's statement at the conference that Lane "is someone who's not well."<ref name=RDrissel /> Ian Friedman, a criminal attorney and past president of the [[Ohio Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers]] said that such things are generally said by defense attorneys. Another attorney said that in this case, he would file a motion which would ensure that the juvenile's mental health would be evaluated before the case was brought to the adult court. As of March 1, 2012, Lane's defense had filed no motions.<ref name=RDrissel />
On March 1, 2012, prosecutors formally charged Lane with three counts of aggravated murder, two counts of aggravated attempted murder, and one count of felonious assault.<ref name=Stern>{{cite web| last=Stern|first=Andrew|title=Suspect in Ohio school shooting charged with murder| work= Reuters.com|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=March 1, 2012}}</ref><ref name=CBS2>{{cite news| title= Ohio teen TJ Lane charged with 3 juvenile counts of aggravated murder in school shootings| url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-504083_162-57388888-504083/ohio-teen-tj-lane-charged-with-3-juvenile-counts-of-aggravated-murder-in-school-shootings/|publisher=CBS News| accessdate=March 1, 2012}}</ref> Lane did not enter a plea when he was arraigned on March 6. Two additional defense attorneys were assigned to the case in March,<ref name=CBSInteractive>{{cite news| title=Ohio teen TJ Lane in court over shooting deaths|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-201_162-57391782/ohio-teen-tj-lane-in-court-over-shooting-deaths/| work= CBS News | publisher= CBS Interactive, Inc.|accessdate=March 7, 2012}}</ref> and the judge postponed the decision to try Lane as an adult until after a competency evaluation was completed.<ref name=APComp>{{cite news|title=Competency exam for Ohio school shooting suspect| url= http://www.fresnobee.com/2012/03/28/2778498/competency-exam-for-ohio-school.html#storylink=cpy| work=fresnobee.com| agency=Associated Press| accessdate= April 11, 2012}}</ref> On April 9, Lane again appeared before Judge Grendell who set the date for a competency hearing for May 2. He also scheduled a hearing for May 12 to determine whether the defendant would be tried as an adult.<ref name=HPComphearing>{{cite news|title=T.J. Lane To Undergo Competency Test Before Ohio School Shooting Trial| url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/04/09/tj-lane-competency-test_n_1413579.html| work= The Huffington Post |accessdate=April 11, 2012|first=Michael|last=McLaughlin|date=April 9, 2012}}</ref>
The competency evaluation might have been requested by either the prosecution or the defense. It was speculated by one observing attorney that the judge might have made the decision himself. According to Ohio law, "a child may be found competent only if able to grasp the seriousness of the charges, if able to understand the court proceedings, if able to aid in the defense and if able to understand potential consequences. The law says a child with a mental illness or an intellectual or developmental disability may not be found competent."<ref name=APComp />
The competency hearing was held on May 2, 2012. Testimony was given by psychiatrist Dr. Phillip Resnick. Resnick testified that Lane was mentally ill. He said the defendant was suffering from psychosis that caused hallucinations and loss of contact with reality, but "does not interfere with Lane's ability to understand the charges against him."<ref name=Kaufman/> Judge Grendell determined at this hearing that Lane was competent to stand trial.<ref name=Kaufman/>
In June 2012, it was determined that Lane would be tried as an adult. He was indicted on the six charges that were filed earlier in March: three counts of aggravated murder, two counts of attempted murder and one count of felonious assault. On June 8, he pleaded not guilty to those charges. His bail was set at $1 million, and he was scheduled to be transferred from the juvenile detention center to county jail on June 18.<ref name=Muscal>{{cite news| last= Muscal |first=Michael|title=Ohio school shooting suspect pleads not guilty in 3 deaths| url= http://www.latimes.com/news/nation/nationnow/la-na-nn-teen-shooting-20120608,0,5185518.story| work=The Los Angeles Times |accessdate=June 8, 2012| date=June 8, 2012}}</ref> However, on June 20, a motion was filed with the Geauga County Court of Common Pleas stating that if someone were to pay a $120 fee, he could remain in the Portage-Geauga County Juvenile Detention Center.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/attorney-someones-paying-for-chardon-shooting-suspect-to-stay-at-juvenile-facility |title=Attorney: Someone's paying for Chardon shooting suspect to stay at juvenile facility |website=Newsnet5.com |date=June 20, 2012 |accessdate=January 2, 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120924022342/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/attorney-someones-paying-for-chardon-shooting-suspect-to-stay-at-juvenile-facility# |archive-date=September 24, 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }}</ref> On February 26, 2013, Lane pleaded guilty to the charges for which he had been indicted.<ref name= "Caniglia: sentenced">{{cite news| url= http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2013/03/tj_lane_sentenced_in_chardon_h.html |title= T.J. Lane sentenced to life in prison in Chardon High School shootings|work= The Plain Dealer |publisher= Cleveland Live LLC |first= John |last= Caniglia |date= March 19, 2013 |accessdate= April 7, 2013 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |first=Tracey |last=Read |title= Chardon High School Shooter T.J. Lane Pleads Guilty |url=http://www.news-herald.com/articles/2013/02/27/news/doc512cc4e588790622038394.txt |work=[[The News-Herald (Ohio)|The News-Herald]] |date=February 27, 2013 |accessdate=March 2, 2013 }}</ref>
On March 19, 2013, Lane was sentenced to three life sentences in prison without parole.<ref name="Plain Dealer Killer T-shirt">{{cite news|title=T.J. Lane wears 'Killer' T-shirt at sentencing for murder of 3 Chardon students|url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2013/03/tj_lane_wears_killer_t-shirt_a.html#incart_big-photo|newspaper= The Plain Dealer| date= March 19, 2013}}</ref><ref name="NY Daily News sentencing">{{cite news| last= Ng| first= Shelley| title= 'F--- all of you!': Ohio teen psycho T.J. Lane gives the finger and smirks as he is sentenced to life for shooting rampage that left three Chardon High School students dead| url= http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/ohio-teen-faces-life-prison-shooting-rampage-left-high-school-students-dead-article-1.1292702|newspaper=New York Daily News|date=March 19, 2013}}</ref> After entering the courtroom, he took off his dress shirt to reveal a white T-shirt underneath which had the word "KILLER" handwritten across the front.<ref name="Plain Dealer Killer T-shirt"/> He smiled and smirked during the hearing.<ref name="Plain Dealer Killer T-shirt"/><ref name="ABCSnuckTShirt">{{cite news|last=Ng|first=Christina|title=How Ohio School Killer TJ Lane Snuck 'Killer' T-Shirt Past Authorities |url= http://abcnews.go.com/US/ohio-school-killer-tj-lane-snuck-killer-shirt/story?id=18774193|newspaper=ABC News|date=March 20, 2013}}</ref> After being sentenced, Lane said to the victims' families and the courtroom, "This hand that pulled the trigger that killed your sons now masturbates to the memory. F*** all of you," while giving the [[Finger (gesture)|middle finger]].<ref name="NY Daily News sentencing"/><ref name= "Caniglia: sentenced" /><ref name="CBS News sentencing">{{cite web|title=TJ Lane, Ohio high school shooter, sentenced to life in prison without parole|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-504083_162-57575092-504083/tj-lane-ohio-high-school-shooter-sentenced-to-life-in-prison-without-parole/|publisher=CBS News |accessdate= March 19, 2013}}</ref>
==Community reaction== On the morning of the shooting, [[Ohio Governor]] [[John Kasich]] issued a statement in which he praised the Chardon Police and [[Geauga County, Ohio|Geauga County]] Sheriff's office for their handling of the incident and pledged support to the community.<ref>{{cite web|title=BREAKING: Five students shot at Chardon High School, student suspect in custody|url=http://www.woio.com/story/17024182/breaking-chardon| publisher=WOIO.com |accessdate=February 27, 2012}}</ref> The following day, Kasich ordered that the flag at the [[Ohio Statehouse]], as well as all flags in Geauga County, be [[Half-staff#United States|flown at half-staff]].<ref name=newsnet5>{{cite web|title=Ohio Gov. John Kasich orders Statehouse, Geauga flags at half-staff for Chardon shooting victim|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/ohio-gov-john-kasich-orders-statehouse-geauga-flags-at-half-staff-for-chardon-shooting-victim|publisher=Scripps TV Station Group|accessdate=February 28, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301234534/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/ohio-gov-john-kasich-orders-statehouse-geauga-flags-at-half-staff-for-chardon-shooting-victim|archive-date=March 1, 2012|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
In the wake of the event, officials closed all Chardon schools on February 28.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-17182562|title=Ohio shooting: One dead at Chardon High School|publisher=BBC News|date=February 27, 2012|accessdate=February 27, 2012}}</ref> The School Department provided counseling and scheduled a gradual return to school for the students, teachers and staff, with school resuming in full on Friday, March 2, 2012.<ref name="School Alert">{{cite web|title=Chardon Local Schools Alert/Information – 2/29/12|url=http://www.chardon.k12.oh.us/|publisher=Chardon Local Schools|accessdate=February 29, 2012}}</ref> On the night of February 27, there were several vigils held, including one at Assembly of God Church.<ref name=Steer>{{cite web| last=Steer| first=Jen| title=Vigil offers prayers, comfort after deadly Chardon High School shooting| url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/vigil-offers-prayers-comfort-after-deadly-chardon-high-school-shooting| publisher=Scripps TV Station Group| accessdate=February 28, 2012| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301203838/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/vigil-offers-prayers-comfort-after-deadly-chardon-high-school-shooting#| archive-date=March 1, 2012| dead-url=yes| df=mdy-all}}</ref> After it was suggested on [[Facebook]],<ref name=Waterhouse>{{cite web|last=Waterhouse|first=Mike|title=Thousands join Facebook-started effort to wear red in support of Chardon High School after shooting|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/thousands-join-facebook-started-effort-to-wear-red-in-support-of-chardon-high-school-after-shooting|publisher=Scripps TV Station Group|accessdate=February 28, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120301185140/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/thousands-join-facebook-started-effort-to-wear-red-in-support-of-chardon-high-school-after-shooting#|archive-date=March 1, 2012|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref> tens of thousands agreed to wear red, one of Chardon High School's [[school colors]], on February 28 in support of the school.<ref name=Steer2>{{cite web|last=Steer|first=Jen|title=United Way creates Chardon Healing Fund, TJ Lane likely to face aggravated murder charges|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/united-way-creates-chardon-healing-fund-tj-lane-likely-to-face-aggravated-murder-charges|publisher=Scripps TV Station Group|accessdate=February 29, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120302190930/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/united-way-creates-chardon-healing-fund-tj-lane-likely-to-face-aggravated-murder-charges|archive-date=March 2, 2012|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref> [[United Way of America|The United Way]] set up The Chardon Healing Fund to help those traumatized by the shooting. The fund had already acquired $150,000 by the time its creation was announced on February 28.<ref name=Steer2 />
In the evening of the day following the attack, thousands of people attended a vigil at St. Mary's Catholic Church in Chardon, where a funeral mass was scheduled for victim Daniel Parmertor, to take place the following weekend.<ref name=Dissell>{{cite web| last=Dissell|first=Rachel|title=Ohio Gov. John Kasich encourages thousands at Chardon vigil to comfort, support grieving families| url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/02/vigil.html|publisher=Cleveland Live LLC|accessdate=February 29, 2012}}</ref> As on February 28, people in attendance wore red. Chardon High School Principal Andy Fetchik spoke to rally the student body and encourage them to help each other during the healing process,<ref name=Dissell /> while Kasich encouraged Chardon residents to support those who had lost loved ones.<ref name=Dissell /> The following day, President Barack Obama telephoned Fetchik and expressed his condolences for the death of the students, saying that both he and First Lady [[Michelle Obama]] were praying for the high school community.<ref name=Koff>{{cite web| last= Koff| first= Stephen| title=President Obama calls Chardon High principal, expresses condolences|work=The Plain Dealer|publisher=Cleveland Live LLC |url=http://www.cleveland.com/open/index.ssf/2012/02/president_obama_calls_chardon.html |accessdate=February 28, 2012}}</ref>
===Students return to school=== On March 2, 2012, the students entering the building received a warm welcoming. A student from [[West Geauga High School]], her mother, and neighbour organised the "Line Up At Chardon" event via Facebook. They welcomed the students of Chardon high school back into the school building with a giant sign that says "[[I'll Stand By You]]" referencing the song by [[The Pretenders]]. More than 100 children from the surrounding school districts, including West Geauga, came to show support. Also, the students of Chardon High School and their parents attended a "walk through" of the school. The senior class officers organised a procession from Chardon Square to the school that morning. The organizers invited participation in the {{convert|0.75|mi|km|3|abbr=on}} walk on Facebook; the day before the activity, over 225 students had shown interest in participating.<ref name= walk>{{cite web|first= John| last=Horton|title=Chardon High School students to walk together back to school this morning|url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/02/chardon_high_school_student_to.html|work=Cleveland.com; The Plain Dealer|accessdate=March 2, 2012| }}</ref><ref name=WOIO>{{cite web|title=Chardon students march in solidarity back to high school| work=Action News|publisher=WorldNow and WOIO| url= http://www.woio.com/story/17024182/breaking-chardon|accessdate=March 2, 2012}}</ref>
Classes resumed the next day. The cafeteria, where the shooting took place, was repainted and reorganised. The table where most of the victims were sitting at the time of the attack remained in place, however, as "a counterpoint to the way the other tables are arranged". The table was covered with flowers and stuffed animals.<ref name=CNN>{{cite news|title=Ohio high schoolers head back to class after fatal shooting|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/03/02/justice/ohio-school-shooting/index.html|work=CNN Justice|publisher=Cable News Network. Turner Broadcasting System, Inc.|accessdate=March 2, 2012|date=March 2, 2012}}</ref>
===Funerals and protest=== On March 2, 2012, [[WEWS-TV]] reported that Fred Phelps, Jr., whose [[Fred Phelps|father]] founded the [[Westboro Baptist Church]] (WBC), had posted on Twitter that the WBC was planning to "street-preach" about the Ohio shooting "regarding God's hand, judgments and vengeance in this affair."<ref name=MWaterhouse>{{cite web|last=Waterhouse|first=Mike|title=Chardon supporters to create human barricade against Westboro funeral protesters|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/chardon-supporters-to-create-human-barricade-against-westboro-funeral-protesters|work=newsnet5.com|publisher=Scripps TV Station Group|access-date=March 3, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120304145000/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/chardon-supporters-to-create-human-barricade-against-westboro-funeral-protesters#|archive-date=March 4, 2012|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref> Another Twitter post from a member of the church said the group would protest Daniel Parmertor's funeral. In response, Chardon resident Alex Pavlick sent out a request on Facebook for people to join him in forming a barricade around St. Mary's Church, where the funeral was to be held on March 3, if the WBC showed up to protest. He wrote that he wanted to ensure the funeral was not ruined by "a group of extremists."<ref name=MWaterhouse /> By the time the story was posted on the television station's web site, 1600 people had agreed to join Alex in his counter-protest. The day of the funeral, the television station reported that a human barricade consisting of thousands had readied, but the WBC protestors did not come.<ref name=Byrne>{{cite web|last=Byrne|first=Kristin|title=Thousands form human barricade outside Chardon church to protect Parmertor family from protestors|url=http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/thousands-form-human-barricade-outside-chardon-church-to-protect-parmertor-family-from-protestors|work=newsnet5.com|publisher=Scripps TV Station Group|accessdate=March 3, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120304145015/http://www.newsnet5.com/dpp/news/local_news/oh_geauga/thousands-form-human-barricade-outside-chardon-church-to-protect-parmertor-family-from-protestors|archive-date=March 4, 2012|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}}</ref>
Three days after Parmertor's funeral, Demetrius Hewlin's funeral was held, also at St. Mary's. Members of four motorcycle clubs, including the [[Patriot Guard Riders]] participated as part of the honor guard.<ref name=DHFuneral>{{cite web|title=Funeral today for Demetrius Hewlin, Ohio school shooting victim|url=http://www.cleveland.com/chardon-shooting/index.ssf/2012/03/funeral_services_begin_for_dem.html|work=The Plain Dealer|publisher=Cleveland Live LLC.|accessdate=March 12, 2012}}</ref> The Patriot Guard was formed specifically to provide a barrier for families of fallen soldiers at funerals which are protested by the Westboro Baptist Church.<ref name=Allen>{{cite news|last=Allen|first=Erin Gibson|title=Patriot Guard honors fallen soldiers at funerals|url=http://www.post-gazette.com/pg/08003/846233-55.stm|work=post-gazette.com|publisher=PG Publishing Co., Inc.|accessdate=March 12, 2012|date=January 3, 2008}}</ref>
==2014 escape from prison== At 7:38 p.m on September 11, 2014, eight days before his 20th birthday, Lane escaped from [[Allen Correctional Institution]] in [[Lima, Ohio]], along with two other inmates. The three inmates escaped using a makeshift ladder to scale a fence during recreation hours.<ref name="wkz">{{cite web | url=http://www.wkyc.com/story/news/local/northeast-ohio/2014/09/11/tj-lane-escape/15485863/ | title=CAPTURED {{!}} Chardon shooter T.J. Lane in custody | publisher=WKYC.com | date=September 12, 2014 | accessdate=September 12, 2014}}</ref> Thirty-three-year-old Lindsey Bruce was quickly captured afterwards. Lane and the other inmate, identified as 45-year-old Clifford Opperud of [[Carlisle, Ohio]],<ref name=Escapes>{{cite news|url= http://www.theepochtimes.com/n3/951282-t-j-lane-escapes-chardon-high-school-shooter-clifford-e-opperud-leave-prison-photo/ |title=TJ Lane Escapes: Chardon High School Shooter Thomas Michael Lane and Clifford E Opperud Leave Prison (Photos); No Word from Parents| work=[[Epoch Times]]|first= Jack |last= Phillips|date= 11 September 2014| accessdate= 26 September 2015}}</ref> who was serving a 12-year sentence for aggravated robbery, aggravated burglary, and kidnapping, remained at large. Police conducted searches at a wooded area and a residential neighborhood near the prison, and considered him and Opperud as "potentially armed and dangerous". Nearby residents were advised to lock their doors and stay inside their homes. Dina Parmertor, Daniel Parmertor's mother, reacted to the escape, saying, "I'm disgusted that it happened. I'm extremely scared and panic stricken. I can't believe it."
At 1:20 a.m. the following day, Lane was captured near the woods, followed by Opperud over three hours later.<ref>{{cite news| url= http://www.19actionnews.com/story/26513962/tj-lane-arrested |publisher= WorldNow and WOIO |title= BREAKING: TJ Lane captured| website=19ActionNews.com | date= 12 September 2014| accessdate= 26 September 2015}}</ref> Chardon High School was closed that same day and counselors were made available to students and staff. Later in the day, Lane, Opperud, and Bruce were transferred to the [[Ohio State Penitentiary]], a [[supermax]] prison in [[Youngstown, Ohio]].<ref>{{cite news| url= http://www.cleveland.com/metro/index.ssf/2014/09/tj_lane_and_other_two_inmates.html |title= T.J. Lane and other two inmates who escaped transferred to Youngstown maximum security prison| website= Cleveland.com | publisher= | date= |agency= Northeast Ohio Media Group |first= Adam| last= Ferrise| accessdate= 26 September 2015}}</ref> In the Youngstown prison, Lane spent 23 hours a day in a cell the size of a small parking space, with one hour of recreation per day.<ref>{{cite news| url= http://www.cleveland.com/court-justice/index.ssf/2014/09/from_pot_to_pokemon_prison_rec.html |title= From pot to Pokemon: Prison records describe T.J. Lane's time behind bars before escape| website= Cleveland.com; [[The Plain Dealer]] | date= 15 September 2014 |first= John |last=Caniglia |accessdate= 26 September 2015}}</ref> As of March 2016, Lane was transferred to the [[Southern Ohio Correctional Facility]], a maximum security prison in [[Lucasville, Ohio]].<ref>{{cite web| url= http://odrc.drc.ohio.gov/offendersearch/details.aspx?id=A640654| publisher= Ohio Department of Rehabilitation and Correction |website= DRC.Ohio.gov| title= Offender Search Detail: Thomas M. Lane III | accessdate= February 7, 2017}}</ref>
